sales_service Module

resources.sales.is_admin(username)[source]

Check if the given username belongs to an admin.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username to check.

Returns:

True if the user is ‘admin’, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class resources.sales.PurchaseResource[source]

Bases: Resource

Resource for handling purchase operations.

post()[source]

Handle POST requests to create a new purchase.

Expects JSON data with ‘goods_id’ and ‘quantity’.

Returns:

A tuple containing a JSON response and HTTP status code.

Return type:

tuple

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Collection[str] | None] = {'POST'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

class resources.sales.PurchaseHistoryResource[source]

Bases: Resource

Resource for handling retrieval of purchase history.

get(username)[source]

Handle GET requests to retrieve purchase history for a user.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username whose purchase history is to be retrieved.

Returns:

A tuple containing a JSON response and HTTP status code.

Return type:

tuple

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Collection[str] | None] = {'GET'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.
